Description of incident: A recent breach involved a U.S.              Army Special Forces document containing the names, Social Security              numbers, home phone numbers and home addresses of 463 soldiers. The              document also contained names and ages of soldiers' spouses and children.              The document was discovered in connection with a Congressional move              to address the continuing risk of data leaks on peer-to-peer (P2P)              networks. Through its research, the firm, Tiversa, turned up the document              among 240 others belonging to federal government agencies and military              branches, all sitting on P2P networks.
